definitions.definition: A garment, usually consisting of a top and trousers (commonly known as tracksuit bottoms) worn as an outer layer by participants in sporting events such as athletics. The tracksuit is usually designed to be easily removed or replaced, before or after competing. Tracksuits have also been adopted in some cultures as leisurewear.
A brief notice of a person’s death, as published in a newspaper.
A biography of a recently deceased person, written by a journalist and published in a newspaper.
A register of deaths in a monastery.
Relating to the death of a person.
One of a breed of dog with a short, white coat with dark spots.
(demonym) A native or inhabitant of Dalmatia.
A game in which players take turns to throw a disc at a target, attempting to hit it with as few throws as possible.
A pipe or system of pipes used to remove human waste and to provide drainage.
To provide (a place) with a system of sewers.
A servant attending at a meal who is responsible for seating arrangements, serving dishes, etc.
One who sews.
A small tortricid moth, the larva of which sews together the edges of a leaf using silk.
definitions.example: the apple-leaf sewer, Ancylis nubeculana

definitions.definition: A type of boat with three parallel hulls.
Not contestable; indisputable; certain
definitions.example: That he was the greatest 100m runner of his generation was incontestable.

definitions.definition: A moot court.
A system of arbitration in many areas of Africa in which the primary goal is to settle a dispute and reintegrate adversaries into society rather than assess penalties.
A gathering of Rovers, usually in the form of a camp lasting 2 weeks.
A social gathering of pagans, normally held in a public house.
An assembly (usually for decision-making in a locality).
A ring for gauging wooden pins.
Subject to discussion (originally at a moot); arguable, debatable, unsolved or impossible to solve.
definitions.example: 1903, Walter Crane and Lewis F. Day, Moot Points: Friendly Disputes on Art and Industry Between Walter Crane and Lewis F. Day

definitions.definition: Being an exercise of thought; academic.
Having no practical impact or relevance.
definitions.example: That point may make for a good discussion, but it is moot.

definitions.definition: A whisper, or an insinuation, also gossip or rumors.
definitions.example: Haven't you heard the moot, mate? There are going to be layoffs. They are going to shit-can the lot of us.

definitions.definition: (rural) Talk.
definitions.example: No, there's no moot of it on the streets.

definitions.definition: To bring up as a subject for debate, to propose.
To discuss or debate.
To make or declare irrelevant.
To argue or plead in a supposed case.
To talk or speak.
definitions.example: 'Tis no boot to moot again of it.

definitions.definition: To say, utter, also insinuate.
definitions.example: He could not moot the words.

definitions.definition: Vagina.
The stump of a tree; the roots and bottom end of a felled tree.
To take root and begin to grow.
To turn up soil or dig up roots, especially an animal with the snout.
The doctrine that everything has been foreordained by a God or by fate.
(specifically) The doctrine that certain people have been elected for salvation, and sometimes also that others are destined for reprobation.
Destiny or fate.
A pigment, dye etc added to something to change its colour or hue
An experience of something in advance.
An advance showing of a film, exhibition etc.
Something seen in advance.
A facility for seeing and checking a document, or changes to it, before saving and/or printing it.
To show or watch something, or part of it, before it is complete.
A spiced dish of rice, blended with meat and/or vegetables.
(grammar) the writing of speech, using the exact words of the speaker, usually between quotation marks
An avoirdupois ounce, weighing 1/16 of an avoirdupois pound, or 28.3495 grams.
A troy ounce, weighing 1/12 of a troy pound, or 480 grains, or 31.1035 grams.
A US fluid ounce, with a volume of 1/16 of a US pint, 1.8047 cubic inches or 29.5735 millilitres.
A British imperial fluid ounce, with a volume of 1/20 of an imperial pint, 1.7339 cubic inches or 28.4131 millilitres.
A little bit.
definitions.example: He didn't feel even an ounce of regret for his actions.

definitions.definition: A large wild feline, such as a lynx or cougar.
Now specifically, the snow leopard, Uncia uncia.
The notional area of land able to be farmed in a year by a team of 8 oxen pulling a carruca plow, usually reckoned at 120 acres.
A device pulled through the ground in order to break it open into furrows for planting.
definitions.example: The horse-drawn plough had a tremendous impact on agriculture.

definitions.definition: The use of a plough; tillage.
Alternative form of Plough (Synonym of Ursa Major)
A joiner's plane for making grooves.
A bookbinder's implement for trimming or shaving off the edges of books.
To use a plough on to prepare for planting.
definitions.example: I've still got to plough that field.

definitions.definition: To use a plough.
definitions.example: Some days I have to plough from sunrise to sunset.

definitions.definition: To have sex with, penetrate.
To move with force.
definitions.example: Trucks plowed through the water to ferry flood victims to safety.

definitions.definition: To furrow; to make furrows, grooves, or ridges in.
To run through, as in sailing.
To trim, or shave off the edges of, as a book or paper, with a plough.
(joinery) To cut a groove in, as in a plank, or the edge of a board; especially, a rectangular groove to receive the end of a shelf or tread, the edge of a panel, a tongue, etc.
(university slang) To fail (a student).
Land that has been or is meant to be ploughed
An administrative unit of government; office.
An organization or office for collecting or providing information or news.
definitions.example: a news bureau; a travel bureau; a service bureau; an employment bureau; the Citizens Advice Bureau

definitions.definition: An office (room where clerical or professional duties are performed).
A desk, usually with a cover and compartments that are located above the level of the writing surface rather than underneath, and often used for storing papers.
A chest of drawers for clothes.
A gelatinous mass of frogs' eggs, laid in ponds and ditches.
A branch of applied mathematics that studies strategic situations in which individuals or organisations choose various actions in an attempt to maximize their returns.
A pendant that opens to reveal a space used for storing a photograph or other small item.
The upper metallic cap of a sword’s scabbard.
A small white marking on a cat's coat.
(dated in US) A physician who specialises in diseases of the female reproductive system.
A young child who has started walking but not fully mastered it, typically between one and three years old.
One who adjudicates.
To avoid or get around something; to bypass
To surround or besiege
To outwit or outsmart
The entire contents of a cell comprising the nucleus and the cytoplasm. It is a semi-fluid, transparent substance which is the living matter of plant and animal cells.
A performance of stand-up comedy; jokes delivered standing on a stage
definitions.example: Sometimes the club has music, sometimes stand-up.

definitions.definition: A comedian who performs on stage.
A short meeting performed while standing up.
definitions.example: How come you weren't at the stand-up this morning?

definitions.definition: A free-standing photographic print or promotional item; a standee.
Honest; honorable.
definitions.example: He's a stand-up guy, and a hard worker.

definitions.definition: Upright; while standing.
definitions.example: stand-up comedy

definitions.definition: Performed while standing although normally done while sitting.
definitions.example: every morning we have a stand-up meeting

definitions.definition: (of a hit) That allows the batter to advance to a given base (usually second or third) without having to slide.
definitions.example: stand-up double

definitions.definition: News that has either just happened or is currently happening.
definitions.example: Breaking news may contain incomplete information, factual errors, or poor editing because of a rush to publication.

definitions.definition: A sharp, pointy object, such as a sliver or splinter.
A bur; a seed pod with sharp features that stick in fur or clothing.
A small piece of material left on an edge after a cutting operation.
A thin flat piece of metal, formed from a sheet by punching; a small washer put on the end of a rivet before it is swaged down.
A broad iron ring on a tilting lance just below the grip, to prevent the hand from slipping.
The ear lobe.
The knot at the bottom of an antler.
A rough humming sound.
A uvular "r".
To pronounce with a uvular "r".
To make a rough humming sound.
A metal ring at the top of the hand-rest on a spear.
A tree growth in which the grain has grown in a deformed manner.
Wood of a mottled veneer, usually cut from such a growth.
A knot or lump in thread or cloth.
A surgical operation on the heart while a machine keeps the blood flowing.
A medical instrument used for listening to sounds produced within the body, often combined with a sphygmomanometer
To auscultate, or examine, with a stethoscope.
A worm that lives in the ground.
A worm of the family Lumbricidae, or, more generally, of the suborder Lumbricina.
A contemptible person; a groveller.
A spicy Spanish sausage flavoured with paprika.
Any of various palm-like plants in the genus Pandanus.
A device used to operate an appliance (such as a television), vehicle or mechanical toy from a short distance away.
A means of doing something from a distance.
definitions.example: The bomb was detonated by remote control.

definitions.definition: The act of causing.
The act or agency by which an effect is produced.
Cause and effect; causality.
One of an array of compartments for housing pigeons.
One of an array of compartments for receiving mail and other messages at a college, office, etc.
definitions.example: Fred was disappointed to find his pigeonhole empty except for bills and a flyer offering 20% off on manicures.

definitions.definition: One of an array of compartments for storing scrolls at a library.
A similar compartment in a desk, used for sorting and storing papers.
To categorize; especially to limit or be limited to a particular category, role, etc.
definitions.example: Fred was tired of being pigeonholed as a computer geek.

definitions.definition: To put aside, to not act on (proposals, suggestions, advice).
Not accessible or able to be reached.
Aloof and unfriendly.
Without any serious competition; unbeatable.
A sudden or unexpected failure.
A ludicrous or humiliating situation. Some effort that went quite wrong.
A wine bottle in a (usually straw) jacket.
A state of suspicious guarding towards a spouse, lover etc., from fears of infidelity.
A resentment towards someone for a perceived advantage or superiority they hold.
Envy towards another's possessions
A close concern for someone or something, solicitude, vigilance.
One who bases all decisions on perceived morals, especially one who enforces them with censorship.
A teacher of morals.
A bearing assembly which uses spherical bearing balls as the rolling elements.
(in common usage) An individual spherical ball, usually made of steel or other hard material, suitable for use in a ball-based rolling element bearing.
To refuse or reject (a judge); to declare that the judge shall not try the case or is disqualified from acting.
definitions.example: The judge recused herself from that case, citing a possible conflict of interest.

definitions.definition: (of a judge) To refuse to act as a judge; to declare oneself disqualified from acting.
definitions.example: The judge recused from the case, citing a possible conflict of interest.

definitions.definition: A small, relatively cool star of the main sequence; most stars in the Milky Way are red dwarfs.
A short, sudden intake of breath.
definitions.example: The audience gave a gasp of astonishment

definitions.definition: : A draw or drag on a cigarette (or gasper).
definitions.example: I'm popping out for a gasp.

definitions.definition: To draw in the breath suddenly, as if from a shock.
definitions.example: The audience gasped as the magician disappeared.

definitions.definition: To breathe laboriously or convulsively.
definitions.example: We were all gasping when we reached the summit.

definitions.definition: To speak in a breathless manner.
definitions.example: The old man gasped his last few words.

definitions.definition: To pant with eagerness; to show vehement desire.
definitions.example: I'm gasping for a cup of tea.

definitions.definition: The sound of a gasp.
definitions.example: Gasp! What will happen next?

definitions.definition: To estimate the alcohol content of a person's blood by using a breathalyzer
The hard, flat translucent covering near the tip of a human finger, useful for scratching and fine manipulation.
A retail outlet selling plants, gardening requisites, furniture and other items intended for outdoor use.
Resembling, having the appearance or consistence of, or relating to bone; osseous.
Full of bones
With little flesh; skinny, thin
Having prominent bones
Any structure built above the top full deck (FM 55-501).
Any material structure or edifice built on something else; that which is raised on a foundation or basis.
(sometimes figurative) All that part of a building above the basement.
The sleepers and fastenings, in distinction from the roadbed.
The social sphere of ideology which includes religion, art, politics, law and all traditional values.
A passerine bird, Emberiza citrinella, of western Eurasia, which is mainly yellow in colour.
The northern flicker, Colaptes auratus.
A native or resident of the American state of Alabama.
Considering oneself and one's own interests before others
A closely-cropped military-style haircut.
Impudent; impertinent; impertinently bold, often in a way that is regarded as endearing or amusing.
(of swimwear, underwear, etc.) tending to reveal the cheeks of the buttocks.
(Australian Aboriginal) Poisonous (of animals such as snakes), dangerous, cunning, violent, potent.
Indulged in.
Common sense, initiative, resourcefulness.
Boldness of enterprise; aggressiveness or initiative.
Energy of body and mind, enthusiasm.
Without honor, or causing dishonor.
Lacking respect for ethical principles.
The exercise of authority or power in a burdensome, cruel, or unjust manner.
The act of oppressing, or the state of being oppressed.
definitions.example: The oppression of the poor by the aristocracy was one cause of the French Revolution.

definitions.definition: A feeling of being oppressed.
definitions.example: Our oppression was lifted by the reappearance of the sun.

definitions.definition: Any system of government-run health care.
The juice of plants of any kind, especially the ascending and descending juices or circulating fluid essential to nutrition.
The sapwood, or alburnum, of a tree.
Any juice.
Vitality.
A naive person; a simpleton
To drain, suck or absorb from (tree, etc.).
To exhaust the vitality of.
A short wooden club; a leather-covered hand weapon; a blackjack.
To strike with a sap (with a blackjack).
A narrow ditch or trench made from the foremost parallel toward the glacis or covert way of a besieged place by digging under cover of gabions, etc.
To subvert by digging or wearing away; to mine; to undermine; to destroy the foundation of.
To pierce with saps.
To make unstable or infirm; to unsettle; to weaken.
To gradually weaken.
definitions.example: he saps my energy

definitions.definition: To proceed by mining, or by secretly undermining; to execute saps.
The two-note sound made by the cuckoo.
A Barbadian food made from mashed okra and cornmeal.
Any of various birds, of the family Cuculidae, famous for laying its eggs in the nests of other species; but especially the common cuckoo, Cuculus canorus, that has a characteristic two-note call.
The sound of that particular bird.
The bird-shaped figure found in cuckoo clocks.
The cuckoo clock itself.
A person who inveigles themselves into a place where they should not be (used especially in the phrase a cuckoo in the nest).
Someone who is crazy.
To make the call of a cuckoo.
To repeat something incessantly.
Crazy; not sane.
Small, ring-shaped pasta, stuffed with meat, cheese etc; eaten with a sauce or in a soup
A tool, typically a power-driven machine, used for machining, such as a lathe, milling machine, shaper, planer, hobber, drill press or jig borer.
Having a pleasant melody or sound; tuneful.
To think before taking action.
Having the characteristics of a worthy companion; friendly and sociable.
Showing mercy
Easily or quickly angered or frustrated.
definitions.example: He was a quick-tempered fellow who was generally avoided by his co-workers.

definitions.definition: A beverage containing protein mixed with milk or water for the purposes of improved nutrition, especially in bodybuilding.
Someone who is dominant or has a significant advantage in their field
A reorganization.
To change the organization of.
To modify the terms of a loan, providing relief to a debtor who would otherwise be forced to default.
A particularly bad or mediocre aspect.
In hairstyling, a highlight in a darker colour rather than a lighter one.
A Mexican dish consisting of a flour tortilla wrapped around a filling of meat and/or beans, cheese etc.
Written law, as laid down by the legislature.
(common law) Legislated rule of society which has been given the force of law by those it governs.
A dish consisting of fried veal cutlet.
(by extension) A Germanic dish of breaded and deep-fried meat cutlet.
Of or relating to autumn.
Past the middle of life; in the third stage.
Hydraulic fracturing.
(bowdlerization) Fucking.
The common characteristics of a group of people, especially regarding ancestry, culture, language or national experiences.
An ethnic group.
(casual) Race; common ancestry.
Industrial processes that are very complex or involve large and heavy equipment, facilities, or end products.
A monastery for lamas.
A rotating shaft that drives (or is driven by) a crank.
Not rewarded
The position at the end of the offensive line whose primary jobs are to block and serve as a short receiver.
definitions.example: Jones played tight end.

definitions.definition: A player playing the position of tight end.
definitions.example: The tight end caught the pass.

definitions.definition: Historically, the position at the end of the offensive line whose primary jobs are to block and serve as a short receiver; this position is no longer used today in Canadian football.
A player playing the position of tight end.
To put into peril; to place in danger.
To risk or hazard.
The middle part, cavity, or belly of a sail; the part of a furled sail which is at the center of the yard.
definitions.example: The bunt of the sail was green.

definitions.definition: A push or shove; a butt.

A ball that has been intentionally hit softly so as to be difficult to field, sometimes with a hands-spread batting stance or with a close-hand, choked-up hand position. No swinging action is involved.
definitions.example: The bunt was fielded cleanly.

definitions.definition: The act of bunting.
definitions.example: The manager will likely call for a bunt here.

definitions.definition: The second half of an outside loop, from level flight to inverted flight.
A fungus (Ustilago foetida) affecting the ear of cereals, filling the grains with a foetid dust; pepperbrand.
To push with the horns; to butt.
To spring or rear up.
To intentionally hit softly with a hands-spread batting stance.
definitions.example: Jones bunted the ball.

definitions.definition: To intentionally hit a ball softly with a hands-spread batting stance.
definitions.example: Jones bunted.

definitions.definition: To perform (the second half of) an outside loop.
definitions.example: We had heard that there was an elite group of three or four pilots in Jodhpur called the "Bunt Club", who had successfully bunted their aircraft - that is, carried out the second half of an outside loop. In the Bunt, you pushed the nose down, past the vertical and still further, until you were in horizontal inverted flight, and came out on the other side and rolled it out.

definitions.definition: To swell out.
definitions.example: The sail bunts.

definitions.definition: (of a cat) To headbutt affectionately.
Any of several small, paenungulate herbivorous mammals of the order Hyracoidea, with a bulky frame and fang-like incisors, native to Africa and the Middle East.
A traditional unrefined sugar used throughout South and South-East Asia.
A small-scale production plant that processes sugar cane.
To cause to become an element of something; to insert or fill.
To steep in a liquid, so as to extract the soluble constituents (usually medicinal or herbal).
To inspire; to inspirit or animate; to fill (with).
To instill as a quality.
To undergo infusion.
definitions.example: Let it infuse for five minutes.

definitions.definition: To make an infusion with (an ingredient); to tincture; to saturate.
To pour in, as a liquid; to pour (into or upon); to shed.
A table knife with a sharp, narrow, and often serrated blade designed for cutting tougher foods such as cooked meats.
An angry argument.
Offensive or repulsive; arousing disgust or aversion.
Opposed or in conflict.
To affect in a sudden, unprecedented or surprising manner; to overwhelm a person's ordinarily contrary impulse.
definitions.example: I apologise for my behaviour last night. I don't know what came over me.

definitions.definition: To change one's position or location, especially to someone's place of residence; to come by.
To deceive or get the better of; overreach.
A man who engages in sports; a male athlete.
A man who engages in country sports, such as hunting or fishing.
Singular of sideburns
definitions.example: His left sideburn was longer than the other one.

definitions.definition: (smoking) The unwanted rapid burning down one side of a cigarette that has been ineptly rolled.
